Description: Postcard; printed; photograph showing a group of men squatting on the ground in what appears to be an open-air market and playing dominoes, Egypt.
Curator's comments: Old card; postally used; postmarked Suez, 23rd July 1911, 1.30 pm, countermarked Post Said, the same day, 3.30 pm. The rather extraordinary message reads: "Please don't write such long letters I can hardly read them they are so long & think of the cost of ink, & your valuable time". This curt message is neither signed or personally addressed. It is followed a year later from what may be the same person (EPH-ME 2280) and sent to the same address but the recipient had since moved addresses. It is hardly surprising that the sender did not know she had changed addresses judging by what must have proved a frosty reception to the first card.
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: Cai 152 (printed postcard number (Cairo series))
